poem:
**Market Zephyrs**

Traders in Asia breathe  
like reeds in a gentle breeze,  
tickers sway,  
green digits rise  
on the promise of appeals.  
From Strasbourg to Shanghai,  
hesitant hearts leap,  
government murmurs  
crawl through cables,  
whispering winds of tariffs  
sheathed,  
while courts hold the scales,  
poised as tightrope walkers,  
midair.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stock markets rise in Asia and Europe after Trump tariffs blocked by US court – business live 2.01pm BST White House adviser confident tariff ruling will be overturned Economic adviser to the White House Kevin Hassett has said he is confident the trade court ruling that blocked most of Trump’s trade tariffs will be overruled. Speaking to Fox Business Network, he said: If there are little hiccups here or there because of decisions that activist". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
